meanings.definition: The action of betraying someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her betrayal of her best friend left a deep wound.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal in the movie was unexpected and heartbreaking.
meanings.sent3: The betrayal of the cake by the hungry toddler was swift and complete.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal of the storm clouds, hiding the sun, brought darkness to the land.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal of the compass, pointing in the wrong direction, led the hikers astray.

meanings.definition: The act of being disloyal or unfaithful.
meanings.sent1: His betrayal of his team by sharing their secrets was unforgivable.
meanings.sent2: The betrayal of trust in a relationship can cause irreparable damage.
meanings.sent3: The cat's betrayal of the dog by stealing its bed made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal of the worn-out shoes, causing blisters, made the hike unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal of the old car, breaking down on the highway, stranded the family.

meanings.definition: A breach of trust or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The betrayal of the confidential information led to chaos.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing betrayal from a close friend can be devastating.
meanings.sent3: The betrayal of the umbrella, turning inside out in the wind, was comical.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal of the mirror, showing a distorted reflection, was unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal of the map, leading them in circles, frustrated the travelers.
